story: A junior wizard tried to create a spell matrix using list multiplication. The results were... unexpected. Predict what the enchanted matrix will display after a single modification.
instructions: Predict the exact output. This code uses `*` to create a 2D list, then modifies one cell. Watch out for aliasing!

hints.text: `[row] * 3` doesn't create 3 independent lists. It creates a list containing 3 references to the SAME row object.
When you modify `matrix[0][0]`, you're actually modifying the shared row object that all three 'rows' reference.
The correct way: `matrix = [[0] * 3 for _ in range(3)]` creates independent row lists.

solutionHidden:
# Creating a 3x3 matrix incorrectly
row = [0] * 3
matrix = [row] * 3

print(f"Initial: {matrix}")
print(f"row[0] is row[1]: {matrix[0] is matrix[1]}")

matrix[0][0] = 1
print(f"After matrix[0][0] = 1: {matrix}")
title: Aliasing With Nested Lists
